title: Kervaire invariant
summary: In mathematics, the Kervaire invariant is an invariant of a framed ( 4 k + 2 ) {\displaystyle (4k+2)} -dimensional manifold that measures whether the manifold could be surgically converted into a sphere. This invariant evaluates to 0 if the manifold can be converted to a sphere, and 1 otherwise. This invariant was named after Michel Kervaire who built on work of Cahit Arf.
